text: Arma is a city in Crawford County, Kansas, United States. At the 2020 census, 1,407 people lived there. ==History== Arma was created in 1894. It was named after W.F. Armacost, an early landowner. A post office was opened at Arma in 1891. It was used until it was closed in 1906. Arma was a station on the Missouri Pacific Railroad. ==Geography== Arma is at (37.542775, -94.701807). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 1,407 people, 632 households, and 357 families living in Arma. Of the households, 65.5% owned their home and 34.5% rented their home. The median age was 45.2 years. Of the people, 90.2% were White, 0.8% were Black, 0.7% were Native American, 0.2% were Asian, 0.1% were Pacific Islanders, 1.1% were some other race, and 6.9% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 2.7% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 1,481 people, 657 households, and 372 families living in Arma. ==Education== Arma is part of USD 246 Northeast. Before school unification, the Arma High School mascot was Bulldogs. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Arma â€“ Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 246 , local school district ;Maps * Arma City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Crawford County, Kansas
title: Arma, Kansas
